column2: NORTH DAKOTA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 2. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column8: On the crosswalk.

column2: 3. Diamond-shaped signs:
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 4. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.

column2: 5. When you are involved in an accident, you should:
column8: stop immediately.

column2: 6. It is illegal to drive below the speed limit:
column8: when driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 7. A red traffic sign means?
column8: Stop.

column2: 8. You arrive at the same time as another vehicle at an intersection has no traffic signs or signals. You should:
column4: speed up and get through the intersection.
column6: sound your horn and drive through the intersection with extreme caution.
column8: slow down and yield to the vehicle on the right.
column10: drive through the intersection and make the other vehicle stop.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column8: You must make a U-turn.

column2: 10. Which shape is a yield sign?
column8: Upside-down triangle

column2: 11. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column10: use only one hand on the wheel.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 13. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column6: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Side Road
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 15. When changing lanes, __________ to be sure no one is in the "blind spot".
column8: glance over your shoulder

column2: 16. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: must make a U-turn and then turn right.

column2: 17. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 18. If your accelerator becomes stuck while driving, you should:
column4: shift to park and apply the brakes until you come to a complete stop.
column6: shift to neutral, apply the brakes and try to drive the car safely off the road.
column8: hold the steering wheel firmly and turn the ignition off while the vehicle is moving.
column10: turn the engine off and try to drive the car safely off the roadway.

column2: 19. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 20. ______________ is an unsafe distraction when driving.
column4: Texting a message on your cell phone.
column6: Asking a passenger to enter your mapping request into your GPS.
column8: Leaving early to drive to an appointment.
column10: Controlling an emotion before putting the vehicle in gear.

column2: 21. When turning or changing lanes, drivers must:
column4: signal only if there is traffic.
column6: always signal their intentions even when there are no vehicles.
column8: signal only when driving in traffic at night.
column10: signal only when driving at night.

column2: 22. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: round.

column2: 23. You are approaching an intersection when the signal turns yellow. You should:
column4: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to get through the intersection before the red light comes on.
column8: stop then enter the intersection when safe to do so.

column2: 24. Your vehicles braking distance will be much longer:
column6: on wet, icy or gravel roads.
column8: when driving at night.

column2: 25. When driving on major highways you should:
column4: be ready to react to road hazards.
column8: keep your eyes moving.
